attributes.action: Banks to acknowledge rent payments as equal as mortgage payments.
attributes.additional_details: With the current state of the property markets mainly in wales but across the UK, its impossible to get on the property ladder as a first time buyer. Rent is on the increase and many tenants are paying more in rent than what it would be on a mortgage. Government need to change this to help the current housing crisis in Wales and the UK.
attributes.background: For first time buyers to be able to get on the property ladder by using their rent payments as proof for affordability when trying to purchase a home. If your rent is more than what you could be paying on a mortgage rate then banks should allow this to be accepted for a mortgage.

rejection.details:
Decisions on how to determine the affordability of a mortgage to a potential homeowner is a commercial matter for lenders, not the UK Government or House of Commons.

You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a related action:

Raise stamp duty land tax (SDLT) thresholds for first-time buyers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611488
